member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode
member.summary: Describes the placement of where a control appears on the screen. The target area of the is the which is relative to the . If the is not set, the element where the context menu is attached is used as a target.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.MouseClick
member.summary: A position of the control relative to the mouse position and at an offset that is defined by the and property values. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedAbove
member.summary: A position of the control that aligns its lower edge with the upper edge of the target and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedBelow
member.summary: A position of the control where the control aligns its upper edge with the lower edge of the target and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedToTheLeft
member.summary: A control that aligns its right edge with the left edge of the target and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedToTheRight
member.summary: A position of the control that aligns its left edge with the right edge of the target and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.Center
member.summary: A position of the control where it is centered over the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.Manual
member.summary: A position of the control relative to the upper-left corner of the target and at an offset that is defined by the and property values. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedTop
member.summary: A position of the control that aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the target and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedBottom
member.summary: A position of the control that aligns its lower edge with the lower edge of the target and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedLeft
member.summary: A position of the control that aligns its left edge with the left edge of the target and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.PlacementMode.AlignedRight
member.summary: A position of the control that aligns its right edge with the right edge of the target and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the target. If a screen edge obscures the , the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamContextMenu
member.summary: Represents a pop-up menu that enables a control to expose functionality that is specific to the context of the control.
member.remarks: A context menu (also called contextual, shortcut, and popup or pop-up menu) is a menu in a graphical user interface (GUI) that appears upon user interaction, such as a right mouse click. A context menu offers a limited set of choices that are available in the current state, or context, of the operating system or application.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuBase
member.summary: Represents a control that defines choices for users to select.
member.remarks: The MenuBase is the base class for controls that define choices for users to select. The and inherit from MenuBase.

member.summary: Allows an object to perform an operation, after it's been loaded.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.Primitives.XamHeaderedItemsControl.HierarchicalItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the for this that describes the visual tree of this item, and what property its children are.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.Primitives.XamHeaderedItemsControl.DefaultItemsContainer
member.summary: Gets or sets a DataTemplate that will be used as a container when the items are being generated.

remarks.p: This property takes effect only to the items that are not native containers of the control. For example if you add TextBlock as an item for , the control will wrap the item with container. For generating of this menu item container, the control will use DataTemplete provided by this property.

The root element of the template provided by DefaultItemsContainer should be the native container of the control. For the this is . If the root content of the DataTemplate is not a XamMenuItem, the property will be ignored and an Empty XamMenuItem will be used instead
This DataTemplate will be used for each XamMenuItem in the unless the is set explicitly on the XamMenuItem itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.Primitives.XamHeaderedItemsControl.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets an object that labels the HeaderedItemsControl. The default value is null. The header can be a string, UIElement, or any other content.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.Primitives.XamHeaderedItemsControl.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets a data template used to display a control's header. The default is null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.Primitives.XamHeaderedItemsControl.HeaderIsItem
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Header property has been set to the item of an ItemsControl.

member.summary: Gets the HeaderedItemContainerGenerator that is associated with this control.

member.summary: Gets a List of properties that shouldn't be saved when the PersistenceManager goes to save them.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.Primitives.XamHeaderedItemsControl.PriorityProperties

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenu
member.summary: Displays a menu in a WPF application.

remarks.p:
The XamMenu control is used to display a menu in a WPF application. The XamMenu control supports the following features:
Data binding that allows the control's menu items to be bound to hierarchal data sources.
Programmatic access to the XamMenu object model to dynamically create menus, populate menu items, set properties, and so on.
Customizable appearance through styles, and user-defined templates.
XamMenu is a ItemsControl. Its content properties are Items and ItemsSource. You can read more information about ItemsControl in WPF help dcumentation.

The XamMenu control presents a list of items that specify commands or options for a WPF application. Typically, clicking an item on a menu opens a submenu or causes an application to carry out a command.

An item in a menu can be anything that can be added to an ItemCollection. The is the most common type of item in a XamMenu. A can contain child items. The child items will appear in a submenu when the user chooses a parent .
You can change the menu orientation by property to either horizontal or vertical. Also you can change how the menu opens its submenus by property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenu.NavigationElement
member.summary: Gets or sets a control that will be used for navigation.

remarks.p: The only elements you can set here are Frame and Page. Only those controls support navigation.
When you set this property, all s in the menu will use it to deal with navigation. Except when you set explicitly .

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem
member.summary: Represents a selectable item inside a control.

remarks.p: A XamMenuItem can have submenus. The submenu of the XamMenuItem is made up of the objects within the ItemCollection of a XamMenuItem. It is common for a XamMenuItem to contain other XamMenuItem objects to create nested submenus.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem.MenuOrientation
member.summary: Determinates how menu is orientated. It can be positioned either horizontal or vertical.

remarks.p: For arranging the items, menu uses the panel supplied by ItemsPanel property. The default one is a StackPanel and it allows the items to be arranged vertical or horizontal. If you set another type panel, for example a Grid, then the MenuOrientation property will not be honored automatically. The Grid will take responsibility for arranging the items according its layout logic.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem.HasChildren
member.summary: Indicates if this XamMenuItem has any child XamMenuItem (read-only)

member.summary: Gets a reference to the parent XamMenuItem of this XamMenuItem.

member.summary: Determinates the user preferred position where the popup will be opened for this menu item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem.StaysOpenOnClick
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates that the submenu in which this MenuItem is located should not close when this item is clicked.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the role of a XamMenuItem in the menu.

member.summary: Gets a value to the parent XamMenu of the XamMenuItem.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem.NavigationElement
member.summary: Gets or sets a control that will be used for navigation.

remarks.p: The only elements you can set here are Frame and Page. Only those controls support navigation.
When this property is not set, then will be used to deal with navigation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem.NavigationUri
member.summary: The URI of the content to navigate to.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem.NavigationParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets parameters that are passed to NavigationService.Navigate method.

remarks.p: This is a string that contains parameters which can be reach after navigation complete by NavigationContext.QueryString property. The format must be as follow: /param1/param2/paramN. Each parameter must be separated by /.
remarks.para: If you pass only one parameter you don't need to write '/' sing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamMenuItem.NavigationOnClick
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the will navigate to the content specified in the property when user clicks on it.

member.summary: Event raised when a property on this object changes.
